title: No final decision yet, committee appointed to review SOP – Foreign Ministry
byline: Amid the ongoing controversy over the UN research vessel’s visit, the Sri Lankan Foreign Ministry has clarified that no final decision has been made yet on the matter.

title: Govt rejects UN request to allow research vessel visit to SL
byline: Sri Lanka has rejected a UN request to allow a research vessel into its waters from July 15 to August 20, which will assess the long-term food security in Sri Lankan seas, citing delays in finalizing Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for foreign research vessels as the reason for the refusal, a UN document revealed.

title: Program launched to improve attitudes of three-wheeler drivers in tourism sector
byline: The Clean Sri Lanka Secretariat has introduced a new initiative aimed at enhancing the attitudes, ethics, and service standards of three-wheeler drivers operating within the country’s tourism sector, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: CAA raids shops selling overpriced, labelled edible salt
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) launched a series of raids targeting businesses selling edible salt at inflated prices without proper labelling.

title: ’No-bra, no-exam’ rule at Nigerian university sparks outrage
byline: A university in Nigeria has sparked outrage after a video went viral showing female students being touched to see if they were wearing bras before taking part in an exam.

title: 11.6 percent youngsters addicted to smoking, 18 percent to drinking -survey
byline: A recent study reveals that 11.6 percent of youngsters aged 15 to 21 in Sri Lanka are actively smoking and 18 percent actively drink alcohol.

title: Luxury train hotel “Odyssey Camper” ready to open
byline: A hotel with luxury facilities built inside two railway compartments has been completed at the Ratmalana Main Railway Yard by its own workers, General Manager of Railways Dhammika Jayasundara announced. The unique hotel, named “Odyssey Camper,” is set to open in a few days.

title: Important to stop food waste and improve food security, Prime Minister says
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya says there is an urgent need to reduce the food waste and improve food security in Sri Lanka.

title: Indian actor Mohanlal Wishwanathan currently observing Parliament session
byline: Veteran Indian actor Mohanlal Wishwanathan is currently observing Sri Lanka’s Parliamentary sessions from the Speaker’s gallery.

title: IRD clears significant VAT refund backlog
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has disbursed a large portion of its long-standing tax refund backlog this year, following a targeted intervention by the Finance Ministry to address a major grievance within the business community.

title: SLPA aims to boost efficiency at Colombo Port with Rs.1bn investment in electric prime movers
byline: The Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) is set to enhance its operational capacity and environmental credentials with the procurement of 20 new electrically operated prime movers at a cost of Rs.1 billion.

title: New Appeal Court President, judges sworn in
byline: Senior Additional Solicitor General and President’s Counsel, Nalin Rohantha Abeysooriya was sworn in this morning (19) as the new President of the Court of Appeal before President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Dengue cases rise in Sri Lanka; 14 deaths reported so far
byline: Sri Lanka has recorded 14 dengue-related deaths and 26,775 dengue cases so far this year ,according to the National Dengue Control Unit (NDCU).

title: Keheliya in-laws, daughter also at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella’s son-in-law, daughter-in-law and another daughter appeared before the Bribery Commission today (19) for statements to be recorded.

title: Iran blames Israel for hacking state TV broadcast with calls for uprising
byline: Iranian media said Wednesday that Israel briefly hacked the state television broadcast, airing footage of women’s protests and urging people to take to the streets.

title: Final commissioning tests underway at Kelanitissa Combined Cycle Power Station
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) said that final commissioning tests are currently underway at the Kelanitissa Combined Cycle Power Station.

title: Two former Presidents, former Deputy Minister, MP behind Kurunegala land fraud: Deputy Minister
byline: Two former Presidents, former Deputy Minister Salinda Dissanayake and former MP Manjula Dissanayake have been involved in a 1,000 acre land deal in Kurunegala, Deputy Minister Sunil Ranasinghe told Parliament today.

title: Railway controllers to launch 48-hour token strike tonight
byline: The Railway Controllers’ Union has announced that it will launch a 48-hour token strike starting from midnight today (19), in protest against the authorities’ failure to resolve several longstanding issues.

title: Duminda Dissanayake produced before court
byline: Former Minister Duminda Dissanayake, who is currently in remand custody, was produced before the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court today (19).

title: Six arrested at BIA for attempting to smuggle foreign cigarettes worth Rs. 12.6 Million
byline: Six passengers attempting to smuggle a stock of foreign-made cigarettes valued at Rs. 12.6 million were arrested this morning by Customs officers at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA).

title: Government ready to bring back Sri Lankans in Israel at any time
byline: The government has made all arrangements to bring back Sri Lankan expatriate workers in Israel if a special need arises due to the war situation, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said today.

title: Iran, Israel trade fresh air attacks as Trump weighs US involvement
byline: Iran and Israel traded further air attacks on Thursday as President Donald Trump kept the world guessing about whether the United States would join Israel’s bombardment of Iranian nuclear facilities.

title: Colombo Stock Exchange appoints new Chairman
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) announced the appointment of Dimuthu Abeyesekera as the new Chairman of its Board of Directors.

title: World’s most liveable city for 2025 revealed
byline: It’s official. Vienna is no longer the most liveable city in the world.

title: Health Professionals Association accuses Health Minister of reversing drug pricing policy
byline: The Health Professionals Association today alleged that Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa is attempting to reverse a key pricing policy implemented to prevent financial losses to the government when purchasing medicines from local manufacturers.

title: Israel attacks Iranian nuclear sites, missile damages Israeli hospital
byline: Israel struck a key Iranian nuclear site on Thursday and Iranian missiles hit an Israeli hospital, as President Donald Trump kept the world guessing about whether the U.S. would join Israel in airstrikes seeking to destroy Tehran’s nuclear facilities.

title: MR, Maithri, Ranil, Basil, others involved in USD 110 million cattle import scam: MP
byline: Former Presidents Mahinda Rajapaksa, Maithripala Sirisena, Ranil Wickremesinghe, former Ministers Basil Rajapaksa, P. Harrison, Wijith Wijithamuni de Soysa, Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena and Lakshman Wasantha Perera have been found to be involved in a USD 110 million cattle import scam, NPP MP Nihal Galappathi told Parliament today.

title: Over 73,000 new vehicle registrations recorded following relaxation of imports: DMT
byline: Following the recent relaxation of vehicle imports, the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) announced today that a total of 73,489 new vehicle and electric car registrations have been recorded so far this year, increasing the country’s total vehicle population to 8,528,002.

title: Keheliya’s two more daughters, son-in-law arrested
byline: Two more daughters of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, Chamithri Jayanika Rambukwella and Amali Nayanika Rambukwella—as well as Amali’s husband, were arrested a short while ago by the Bribery Commission in connection with an ongoing investigation into money laundering allegations.

title: Railway Controllers’ 48-hour token strike postponed by two weeks
byline: The 48-hour token strike, which was scheduled to be launched tonight by the Railway Controllers’ Union, has been postponed by two weeks, Union Secretary K.D. Duminda Prasad said.

title: Sri Lanka temporarily relocates Embassy in Iran
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism stated that the Sri Lanka Embassy in Tehran, Iran, has been temporarily relocated due to the prevailing situation in the region.

title: CSE slides further with ASPI dropping under 17,000
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) continued its downward trend, closing the day on a negative note as both the All Share Price Index (ASPI) and the S&P SL20 declined. The sustained downturn was primarily driven by ongoing geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.

title: Moment SpaceX rocket explodes into massive fireball
byline: A live stream has captured the moment a SpaceX Starship rocket exploded into a gigantic fireball when preparing for a flight test. The incident occurred on Wednesday night around 11pm at the Massey’s Testing Center in Texas.

title: COPE like a reality show: Namal
byline: The Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) is just like a reality show as it can only submit documents and get MPs to debate them, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa told Parliament today.

title: Three supermarket outlets fined Rs. 200,000 Each
byline: Three outlets of a leading supermarket chain have been fined Rs. 200,000 each for displaying expired goods for sale, the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) said.

title: Thai PM faces calls to quit after leaked phone call
byline: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra’s coalition government is on the brink of collapse after a phone call between her and former Cambodian leader Hun Sen about a festering border dispute was leaked.

title: Keheliya’s two daughters, son-in-law granted bail
byline: Former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella’s two daughters and son-in-law, who were arrested by the Bribery Commission under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, were released on bail today.

title: AASL, airline representatives meet to boost passenger services and industry ties
byline: In a bid to further enhance passenger services and foster stronger industry collaboration, the Chairman and senior management of Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited (AASL) held a strategic meeting with the Board of Airline Representatives (BAR) this week.

title: Sri Lanka seeks India’s help in evacuating people from conflict-ridden Iran
byline: Sri Lanka has sought India’s assistance in the evacuation of its citizens in Iran which is now engaged in a war with Israel, the Daily Mirror learns.
